Package org.ironmaple.simulation

Class MapleMotorSim

java.lang.Object
org.ironmaple.simulation.MapleMotorSim
public class MapleMotorSim extends Object

DCMotorSim with a bit of extra spice.

This class extends the functionality of the original DCMotorSim and models the following aspects in addition:

  • Friction force on the rotor.
  • Smart current limiting.
  • Brake and coast modes (only for simulating brushless motors).

  • Constructor Details

    • MapleMotorSim

      public MapleMotorSim(SimulatedArena arena, DCMotor motor, double gearRatio, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.MomentOfInertia loadIntertia, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Voltage frictionVoltage)

      Constructs a Brushless Motor Simulation Instance.

      Parameters:
      motor - the DCMotor model representing the motor(s) in the simulation
      gearRatio - the gear ratio of the mechanism; values greater than 1 indicate a reduction
      loadIntertia - the rotational inertia of the mechanism
      frictionVoltage - the voltage required to keep the motor moving at a constant velocity

    • withFeedForward

      public MapleMotorSim withFeedForward(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Voltage kS, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<VoltageUnit,AngularVelocityUnit> kV, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<VoltageUnit,AngularAccelerationUnit> kA)

    • withPositionalVoltageController

      public MapleMotorSim withPositionalVoltageController(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<VoltageUnit,AngleUnit> kP, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<VoltageUnit,AngularVelocityUnit> kD)
      Configures the PD controller for Positional Requests using MapleMotorSim.OutputType.VOLTAGE.

      This is unit safe and can be configure like so: 

      
 // Volts per Rotation of error is how CTRE handles PID when used with voltage requests
 sim.withPositionalVoltageController(
   Volts.per(Rotation).ofNative(100.0),
   Volts.per(RotationsPerSecond).ofNative(5.0)
 );
      Parameters:
      kP - the proportional gain
      kD - the derivative gain
      Returns:
      this instance for method chaining

    • withVelocityVoltageController

      public MapleMotorSim withVelocityVoltageController(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<VoltageUnit,AngleUnit> kP)
      Configures the PD controller for Velocity Requests using MapleMotorSim.OutputType.VOLTAGE.

      This is unit safe and can be configure like so: 

      
 // Volts per RPS of error is how CTRE handles PID when used with voltage requests
 sim.withVelocityVoltageController(
   Volts.per(RotationsPerSecond).ofNative(0.4)
 );
      Parameters:
      kP - the proportional gain
      Returns:
      this instance for method chaining

    • withPositionalCurrentController

      public MapleMotorSim withPositionalCurrentController(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<CurrentUnit,AngleUnit> kP, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per<CurrentUnit,AngularVelocityUnit> kD)
      Configures the PD controller for Positional Requests using MapleMotorSim.OutputType.CURRENT.

      This is unit safe and can be configure like so: 

      
 // Amps per Rotation of error is how CTRE handles PID when used with current requests
 sim.withPositionalCurrentController(
   Amps.per(Rotation).ofNative(100.0),
   Amps.per(RotationsPerSecond).ofNative(5.0)
 );
      Parameters:
      kP - the proportional gain
      kD - the derivative gain
      Returns:
      this instance for method chaining

      This is unit safe and can be configure like so: 

      
 // Amps per RPS of error is how CTRE handles PID when used with current requests
 sim.withVelocityCurrentController(
   Amps.per(RotationsPerSecond).ofNative(0.4)
 );
      Parameters:

      this instance for method chaining
